Handles App Store related actions, like checking if a user has access to to things and then to buy it. More...

Detailed Description

Handles App Store related actions, like checking if a user has access to to things and then to buy it.

Member Function Documentation

bool ParserAppStoreHandler::checkService (  const ClientSetting *  clientSetting,
const HttpInterfaceRequest *  httpRequest,
OperationType::operationType  operationType,
PurchaseOptions &  purchaseOptions,
set< MC2String > &  checkedServiceIDs,
uint32  topRegionID = MAX_UINT32,
LangType::language_t  clientLang = LangTypes::english,
bool  mayUseCachedCheckResult = false
) 
 

Checks if the client is allowed to consume the service.

It will return true if the client is allowed to use the service and and false if the user can not.

Parameters:
clientSetting The setting to check.
httpRequest The http request.
operationType The type of service to consume.
url An url with possible packages to purchase if the user is not allowed to consume the service.
checkedServiceIDs A set with the service ids we have already queried.
topRegionID The top region id for the service requested.
clientLang The client's language type. Default is set to English.
mayUseCachedCheckResult If the result of a previous check may be used as return for this call.
Returns:
True if checked and user has access, false if not.

bool ParserAppStoreHandler::internalVerifyReceipt (  const MC2String &  receipt,
MC2String &  errorReason
)  [private]
 

The internal verifyReceipt that doesn't log to debit log.

And sets some params.

Parameters:
receipt The receipt to check.
errorReason Set to a string describing the reason for the method returning false.
Returns:
True if verification and adding rights succeeded.

bool ParserAppStoreHandler::verifyReceipt (  const MC2String &  receipt  ) 
 

Verify a App Store receipt.

If a purchase was made set the correct right for that particular user.

Parameters:
receipt The receipt to check.
Returns:
True if verification and adding rights succeeded.
